symptoms: Comedones, Papules, Pustules, Nodules, Cysts, Scarring
causes: Cosmetics/topical steroid use, Age of onset around puberty, Recent drug intake, Contact with cutting oils/halogens
brief_info: Acne can present with various lesions on the face and/or trunk, early treatment is important to minimize scarring.

symptoms: Facial redness, Swollen red bumps, Eye problems, Enlarged nose
causes: Triggers like sun exposure, Spicy foods, Alcohol, Stress, Hot weather
brief_info: Rosacea causes redness and visible blood vessels in the face, may also lead to eye problems and thickening of the skin.

symptoms: Hair loss, Bald patches, Thinning hair
causes: Genetics, Hormonal changes, Medical conditions, Medications, Stress
brief_info: Alopecia results in hair loss, which can occur in patches or overall thinning, with various underlying causes.

symptoms: Redness, Swelling, Pain, Warmth, Pus-filled lesions
causes: Bacteria entering the skin through cuts, scrapes, or other breaks in the skin
brief_info: Bacterial skin infections are caused by bacteria entering the skin, leading to symptoms like redness, swelling, and pus-filled lesions.

symptoms: Rash, Itching, Hives, Swelling, Blisters
causes: Reaction to medications, Allergic response to drugs
brief_info: Cutaneous adverse drug reactions are skin reactions caused by medications, leading to symptoms like rash, itching, and hives.

symptoms: Red, itchy, scaly patches, Blisters, Peeling skin
causes: Fungal infection of the skin, Direct contact with an infected person or animal
brief_info: Dermatophytosis is a fungal skin infection that results in red, itchy patches with peeling skin, commonly transmitted through direct contact.

symptoms: Dry, red, itchy skin, Inflammation, Rash, Blisters, Crusting
causes: Genetics, Allergens, Irritants, Immune system dysfunction
brief_info: Eczema/Dermatitis causes inflamed, itchy skin with various symptoms like rash and blisters, often triggered by genetics, allergens, or irritants.

symptoms: Fluid-filled blisters, Erosions, Crusting, Itching, Pain
causes: Autoimmune response, Genetic predisposition, Triggers like drugs or infections
brief_info: Immunobullous dermatoses lead to blistering of the skin due to autoimmune reactions, with symptoms like fluid-filled blisters and erosions.

symptoms: Red, scaly patches, Silvery scales, Itching, Burning, Swollen joints
causes: Immune system dysfunction, Genetics, Triggers like stress or infections
brief_info: Psoriasis causes red, scaly patches on the skin with silvery scales, often accompanied by itching and swollen joints, linked to immune system issues.

symptoms: Depends on the condition being treated and the specific steroid used
causes: Prescribed for various skin conditions to reduce inflammation and symptoms
brief_info: Topical steroids are used to treat skin conditions by reducing inflammation, with specific usage based on the condition and steroid type.

symptoms: Intense itching, Rash, Small red bumps, Scales
causes: Infestation by the human itch mite, Close contact with an infected person
brief_info: Scabies is caused by a mite infestation, leading to intense itching and a rash with small red bumps and scales, commonly spread through close contact.

symptoms: Raised, itchy welts, Swelling, Redness, Burning, Stinging
causes: Allergies, Infections, Stress, Medications, Food
brief_info: Urticaria presents as raised, itchy welts on the skin due to various triggers like allergies, infections, stress, or medications.

symptoms: Blisters, Itching, Fatigue, Fever, Headache
causes: Varicella-zoster virus (chickenpox), Herpes simplex virus
brief_info: Varicella (chickenpox) and Herpes infections lead to symptoms like blisters, itching, fatigue, and fever, caused by specific viruses.

symptoms: Loss of skin color, Patchy depigmentation, Premature whitening of hair
causes: Autoimmune response, Genetic factors, Triggers like stress or sun exposure
brief_info: Vitiligo causes loss of skin color in patches, often accompanied by premature whitening of hair, linked to autoimmune factors and genetic predisposition.

symptoms: Refer with history of delayed cry at birth, abnormal value follow appropriate STW for Neonatal Triage, check vitals and blood glucose
causes: Moderate or severe hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy
brief_info: STW prepared by national experts of India for various healthcare levels, based on expert opinions and scientific evidence

symptoms: Jaundice, transitional stools, minor birth trauma, minor malformations, breastfeeding difficulty, regurgitation
causes: Weight < 1800g or > 3.8kg, respiratory distress, severe jaundice, severe pallor, bleeding, major malformation, abdominal distension, irritable/restless, refusal to feed, hypothermia
brief_info: Guidelines for Paediatric emergency triage, assessment, and treatment by WHO

symptoms: Maintain TABC, check blood glucose, administer dextrose IV, calcium gluconate IV, phenobarbitone IV
causes: Not controlled seizures
brief_info: STW on neonatal seizures

symptoms: Decreased frequency of bowel motions, Passage of hard or large stools, Painful bowel motions with difficulty in pushing out
causes: Various factors including diet, dehydration, lack of physical activity, certain medications
brief_info: Constipation is characterized by infrequent bowel movements and difficulty passing stools. It can be caused by multiple factors and is common in all age groups.

symptoms: Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Cough, Fever, Sweating, Rapid heartbeat
causes: Usually results from a complication of pneumonia, Lung infections, Trauma to the chest
brief_info: Empyema is a condition where pus collects in the pleural space, often as a complication of pneumonia. It can lead to respiratory distress and requires medical intervention.

symptoms: Visible bulge in the abdomen or groin, Pain or discomfort, Swelling or lump
causes: Weakness in the abdominal wall, Increased pressure in the abdomen, Congenital condition
brief_info: Hernia in children, also known as congenital hernia, is a condition where an organ or tissue bulges through a weak spot in the abdominal wall. It is common in infants and young children.

symptoms: Absence of one or both testes in the scrotum, Empty scrotum, Smaller than normal scrotum
causes: Incomplete descent of the testes during fetal development
brief_info: Undescended testes, or cryptorchidism, is a condition where one or both testes fail to move into the scrotum before birth. It requires evaluation and treatment to prevent complications.

symptoms: Difficulty conceiving after a year of regular, unprotected intercourse
causes: Various factors including hormonal imbalances, reproductive system issues, age, lifestyle factors
brief_info: Infertility is the inability to conceive after a year of trying. It can be caused by multiple factors affecting either partner and may require medical intervention for evaluation and treatment.

symptoms: Difficulty conceiving after a year of regular, unprotected intercourse, Irregular menstrual cycles, Hormonal imbalances
causes: Issues with ovulation, Fallopian tube blockages, Uterine problems, Age-related factors
brief_info: Female infertility refers to the inability to conceive after a year of trying for women. It can be due to various factors affecting the reproductive system and may require medical assistance for diagnosis and treatment.

symptoms: Fatigue, Weakness, Pale or yellowish skin, Shortness of breath, Dizziness, Rapid heart rate
causes: Destruction of red blood cells at an abnormally high rate, Inherited conditions, Autoimmune disorders, Infections
brief_info: Haemolytic anemia is a condition where red blood cells are destroyed faster than they can be produced, leading to symptoms like fatigue and shortness of breath. It can be caused by various factors and requires medical management.

symptoms: Blistering of the skin in response to minor injury or friction, Fragile skin, Thickened skin on palms and soles
causes: Genetic mutations affecting proteins that help anchor layers of skin together
brief_info: Epidermolysis bullosa is a group of genetic conditions that cause fragile skin prone to blistering. It is caused by mutations affecting proteins that maintain skin integrity and requires specialized care.

symptoms: Rash, Fever, Swollen liver and spleen, Jaundice, Anemia, Bone deformities, Meningitis
causes: Transmission of syphilis from an infected mother to her baby during pregnancy
brief_info: Congenital syphilis occurs when a baby is born with syphilis due to transmission from an infected mother. It can lead to serious health issues and requires prompt diagnosis and treatment.
